channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti on utility box in Concert Hall Approach, 11th February
item.description:
As above

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Concert Hall Approach, Waterloo, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verge badly damaged by cars, 11th February
item.description:
The grass verge at the top of Reddons Rd, where it meets Lennard Rd, has been driven over by cars multiple times, killing off the grass and leaving it in a terrible, muddy state. See photos. Please could it be re-seeded, and maybe a higher kerb built to deter people picking up school kids from driving up onto it? (Sorry if this report is in the wrong category, there wasn't one for grass verge issues like this).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Reddons Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes on Bounces Road Montagu Road end, 11th February
item.description:
Potholes along this stretch of the road are awful made worse by the recent rainfall as puddles in them don't show how deep they really are, also not helped by HGV vehicles and the weight of the buses has caused the loose bitumen to spread around the road and onto the pavements cause a slip hazard, roads where there is alot of traffic really needs to be maintained on a regular basis roads have been neglected for so long.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bounces Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on green telecoms unit, 11th February
item.description:
Red spray tag on the back (pavement-facing) side of green telecoms cabinet, just outside the girls school, near corner of Reddons Rd.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lennard Road, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on the pavement, 11th February
item.description:
This is a recurrence of an issue that occurred in the past. When my large wheelie bin is "collected", instead of taking the bin to the lorry for emptying, the operatives appear to cherry-pick refuse bags from the bin, which is quicker in their view. Unfortunately, today they have cherry-picked and split one of the bags in the bin and left rubbish on the pavement and also materials at the bottom of the bin.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southlands Road, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
